definitions.definition: To act before (someone), especially to prevent an action.
To take up or introduce (something) prematurely.
definitions.example: The advocate plans to anticipate a part of her argument.

definitions.definition: To know of (something) before it happens; to expect.
definitions.example: Please anticipate a journey of an hour from your house to the airport
Little Johnny started to anticipate the arrival of Santa Claus a week before Christmas.
